pages.title: ORSA — Who Are We?
pages.text: The $(bold)Orbital Resonance Stabilization Authority$() (ORSA) was founded as a joint initiative between the United Nations and the world's leading space agencies.$(br2)Our mission: monitor and maintain Earth's orbital parameters using a global network of $(bold)2,048 resonance stabilization nodes.$()$(br2)For decades, we kept Earth on track. On time. In orbit.$(br2)$(italic)That part worked great.$()

pages.title: What Went Wrong
pages.text: Short answer: $(bold)we don't know.$()$(br2)The resonance pattern that keeps Earth anchored began to decay. Slowly at first. Our systems flagged it. We investigated. We found nothing.$(br2)Then the decay accelerated.$(br2)By the time our models caught up, Earth had already begun to drift. The nodes couldn't compensate. $(italic)Nothing$() was designed for this.

pages.title: The Evacuation
pages.text: When the models confirmed the drift was irreversible, ORSA pivoted to evacuation. $(bold)Project Exodus$() — the largest coordinated operation in human history.$(br2)Every transport, shuttle, and vessel capable of escape was mobilized. Mars colonies expanded overnight.$(br2)$(bold)14 billion people were evacuated in 72 hours.$()$(br2)All but one, apparently.

pages.title: ORSA Divisions
pages.text: $(bold)Science Division$()$(br)Modeled the phase progression. Uncomfortably accurate.$(br2)$(bold)Wellness Division$()$(br)Authored these survival guides. Surprisingly cheerful for an apocalypse.$(br2)$(bold)Logistics Division$()$(br)Managed evacuation. Kevin worked here. Kevin went back for you. Kevin is on Mars now.$(br2)$(bold)Engineering Division$()$(br)Designed the heaters, clothing, and cores. Also launched something into orbit before leaving.

pages.title: ORSA Field Documents
pages.text: Before evacuation, ORSA distributed field documents to outposts and shelters worldwide. These $(bold)written books$() can still be found in structures across the surface.$(br2)They contain research notes, internal memos, and the personal observations of scientists who knew what was coming.$(br2)$(italic)If you find one, read it. Some contain information that was never meant to go public.$()

pages.title: A Final Note
pages.text: To whoever is reading this:$(br2)We are sorry. We were supposed to prevent this. We had the technology, the funding, the mandate. It wasn't enough.$(br2)This guide is the last thing we could give you. Every recipe, every sarcastic aside from Wellness — it's all we have left.$(br2)Stay underground. Stay warm. Stay alive.$(br2)$(italic)— Dr. Elena Vasquez, ORSA Science Director$(br)(The one who flagged the decay. Nobody listened.)$()
